content:
I understand your point of view, but there are some reasons why FIFA and other sports organizations grant an automatic qualification to the host nation:

1. Tradition: The host nation of the World Cup has always received an automatic qualification, and it has become part of the tournament's tradition and history.

2. Financially supporting the host nation: Organizing such a major sports event requires substantial investment in infrastructure, stadiums, transportation, accommodation, and security. Granting the host nation an automatic qualification is one way to compensate them for this investment in the tournament.

3. Boosting local interest: Having the host nation participate directly in the World Cup can generate more local interest and support for the tournament, encouraging more people to buy tickets and watch the matches.

However, to compensate for the potential advantages that the host nation has, FIFA has taken some steps to ensure fairness in the World Cup's organization. For example, they use seeding procedures, grouping teams by regions, and balancing the schedule to ensure that no team gets an easy route to the final.
